unit_spear.name: Spear fighter
unit_spear.desc: The spear fighter is the most basic unit. It is good in defending against cavalry and to start plundering other villages.

unit_sword.name: Swordsman
unit_sword.desc: The swordsman is a relatively slow unit effective as defense especially against infantry.

unit_axe.name: Axeman
unit_axe.desc: The axeman is a strong offensive unit. They easily forget to protect themselves though.

unit_archer.name: Archer
unit_archer.desc: The archer is a very effective defensive unit. Their arrows destroy even the hardest armor.

unit_spy.name: Scout
unit_spy.desc: The scout creeps into your enemies' villages to get valuable information.

unit_light.name: Light cavalry
unit_light.desc: The light cavalry is a good offensive unit. One of its advantages is its speed.

unit_marcher.name: Mounted archer
unit_marcher.desc: The mounted archer is especially useful to disable your enemies archers on the Walls.

unit_heavy.name: Heavy cavalry
unit_heavy.desc: The heavy cavalry are your elite troops. The noble knights have hardened weapons and strong armor.

unit_ram.name: Ram
unit_ram.desc: Rams support your troops in your attacks as it damages your enemies' Wall.

unit_catapult.name: Catapult
unit_catapult.desc: Catapults are especially good in destroying your enemies' buildings.

unit_knight.name: Paladin
unit_knight.desc: The noble paladin protects you and your allies' villages from enemy attacks. Each player may only have one paladin.

unit_snob.name: Nobleman
unit_snob.desc: A nobleman will reduce the loyalty of your enemies' villages. If its loyalty falls under 0 you conquer that village. The costs for each nobleman increase with every conquered village and every nobleman that is available or in production.

building_main.name: Village Headquarters
building_main.description: In the village headquarters you can construct new buildings or upgrade existing ones. The higher the level of your headquarters, the faster the constructions will be finished. As soon as your Village Headquarters are upgraded to level 15, you will be able to demolish buildings in this village.
building_main.change_order: Here you can change the order of your building queue by dragging them to the desired location with your mouse.
building_main.queue_info: Additional cost for the next assignment in the building queue: {x}
building_main.queue_text: There is no refund for the additional costs that were charged for putting a building into the building queue
building_main.nameTooShort: The village name has to contain at least 3 characters.
building_main.cannotBuild: Can't be built in this village
building_main.storageTooSmallQueue: Warehouse too small to build in queue.
building_main.tooFewResQueue: Not enough resources available to add assignment to building queue.
building_main.fully_destroyed: Building can not be demolished any further
building_main.ajax_build: The building order was successfully queued.
building_main.queueBuild: Assignments added to the building queue will cost more. Do you still want to add this assignment?
building_main.orderSuccess: The building order was successfully queued.

building_barracks.name: Barracks
building_barracks.description: In the barracks you can recruit infantry. The higher its level the faster the recruitment of troops will be finished.

building_stable.name: Stable
building_stable.description: In the stables you can recruit cavalry. The higher its level the faster the recruitment of the troops will be finished.

building_garage.name: Workshop
building_garage.description: In the workshop you can produce rams and catapults. The higher its level the faster the recruitment will be finished.

building_church_f.name: First church
building_church_f.description: The first church gives all the villages in the nearby area belief. When a village has belief, its troops fight at 100% effectiveness instead of 50%. The first church is built by default in your first village, and can only be built once.

building_church.name: Church
building_church.description: The church gives all the villages in the nearby area belief. When a village has belief, its troops fight at 100% effectiveness instead of 50%.

building_snob.name: Academy
building_snob.description: In the academy you can educate noblemen. They will help you conquer other villages.
building_snob.coin_minted: You have minted a gold coin

building_smith.name: Smithy
building_smith.description: In the smithy you can research and improve weapons. Upgrading the smithy allows the research of better weapons and decreases the research time.

building_place.name: Rally point
building_place.description: On the rally point your fighters meet. Here you can command your armies.

building_statue.name: Statue
building_statue.description: At the statue the villagers render homage to your paladin. If your paladin dies you can appoint one of your fighters to become the new paladin.

building_market.name: Market
building_market.description: On the market you can trade with other players.

building_wood.name: Timber camp
building_wood.description: Outside of your village in the dark forests your lumberjacks cut massive trees to produce wood in the timber camp, which is needed for buildings and weapons. The higher its level the more wood is produced.

building_stone.name: Clay pit
building_stone.description: In the clay pit your workers extract clay, which is important for new buildings. The higher its level the more clay is produced.

building_iron.name: Iron mine
building_iron.description: In the iron mine your workers dig the war-crucial iron. The higher its level the more iron is produced.

building_farm.name: Farm
building_farm.description: The farm supplies your workers and troops with food. Without extending your farm your village cannot grow. The higher its level the more villagers can be supplied.

building_storage.name: Warehouse
building_storage.description: The warehouse stores your resources. The higher its level the more resources can be stored.

building_hide.name: Hiding place
building_hide.description: Resources in your hiding place cannot be plundered by your enemies. The bigger it is, the more it can hold. There is no place to hide your troops though. Even your enemies' scouts cannot spot the resources hidden in your hiding place.

building_wall.name: Wall
building_wall.description: The wall defends your village against your enemies' troops. The higher its level the better the basic defense of your village. It also increases the defensive strength the troops stationed in the village.

index.title: TWLan - Tribal Wars LAN Version
index.description: Tribal Wars is a browser-based game set in the Middle Ages. Every player controls a small village, striving for power and glory.
index.loginText: Click the login button to log into the game world!
index.wrongIP: TWLan may only be player in your local network!

register.title: Register

register.nameTooShort: The name has to contain at least 4 characters!
register.nameTooLong: The name may not exceed 50 characters!

register.passwordEqualsName: The password may not be the same as your user name!
register.passwordTooShort: The password has to contain at least 4 characters!
register.passwordTooLong: The password may not exceed 50 characters!
register.passwordsDontMatch: The password must be entered twice, and be exactly the same.

game.ally.defaultDescription: If you have questions please contact [player={owner}][/player].[br][br][i]This text can be changed by the tribal diplomats.[/i]
game.ally.confirmLeave: Are you sure you want to leave your tribe?

game.ally.diplomaty.head: On this page your relations with other tribes are administered. The settings are non-binding within the game, but villages will be coloured accordingly on the map. The status is visible only to tribe members and may be changed by tribal diplomats only.
game.ally.diplomaty.alreadyrelation: There is already a relationship to this tribe.

game.ally.events.4: The tribe now has a NAP with {toTribe}.

game.ally.events.9: {fromPlayer} changed the privileges and title of {toPlayer}.
game.ally.events.12: {fromPlayer} changed the description of the tribe.
game.ally.events.666: The tribe has canceled their relationship with {toTribe}.

game.ally.forum.admin.not_yet_confirmed: This tribe has not yet agreed to sharing the forum

knight_items_desc.spear: Increases the offensive fighting power of your spear fighters by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.sword: Increases the offensive fighting power of your swordsmen by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.axe: Increases the offensive fighting power of your axemen by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.archer: Increases the offensive fighting power of your archers by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.spy: Scouts can see units from the scouted village that are not at home.
knight_items_desc.light: Increases the offensive fighting power of your light cavalry by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.heavy: Increases the offensive fighting power of your heavy cavalry by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.marcher: Increases the offensive fighting power of your mounted archers by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knight_items_desc.ram: Increases the damage caused by rams by %special
knight_items_desc.catapult: Increases the damage by catapults by %special
knight_items_desc.snob: The nobleman lowers the loyalty by at least %special.
